literal: You! The one naked, what do you need? I need a ring made of gold my lord.
equivalent: Putting the cart before the horse.
darija_ar: أش خاصك يا العريان, خاصني خاتم الذهب يا مولاي.

literal: One bitten by a snake will fear a cord.
equivalent: The burnt child dreads the fire.
darija_ar: اللي عضو الحنش كيخاف من الحبل.

literal: He came to help her with her eyeliner and blinded her.
equivalent: Adding insult to injury.
darija_ar: جا يكحلها عماها.

literal: If one doesn't have money, their speech is tasteless.
equivalent: Money talks.
darija_ar: اللي ما عندو فلوس كلامو مسوس.

literal: Say nice things on your friend around others; chastise him face to face.
equivalent: Praise in public, criticize in private.
darija_ar: امدح صاحبك مع الناس ولومو الراس فالراس.

literal: One eye saw and the other eye did not see.
equivalent: Turning the blind eye.
darija_ar: دير عين شافت وعين ماشافت.

literal: Put a plastic bag on your eye.
equivalent: Turn the blind eye.
darija_ar: دير عين ميكا.

literal: You don't feel the whip unless you are the one being beaten with it.
equivalent: You never know a man until you walk a mile in his shoes.
darija_ar: ما تيحس بالمزود غير اللي مخبوط به.
explanation: You wouldn't understand unless you experienced it.

literal: Start them off with crayons.
equivalent: breaking it down Barney style.
darija_ar: خصك معاهم الخشيبات.
explanation: This is phrase is appropriate for situations where someone needs to start out from the most basic level to understand a lesson or task. It is similar to 'breaking it down Barney style', explaining it in a way that a child can comprehend.

literal: Even the owner of the crown (the king) has needs.
equivalent: It rains on the rich and poor alike.
darija_ar: مول التاج كيحتاج.
explanation: It rains on the rich and poor alike'. Even the wealthy experience problems.

literal: Think about it 101 times before cutting with the scissors.
equivalent: Measure twice, cut once.
darija_ar: مية تخميمة وتخميمة ولا ضربة بالمقص.
explanation: Think hard before making a decision which may have permanent consequences.

literal: If one wants honey, they must endure the sting of bees.
equivalent: No pain, no gain.
darija_ar: اللي بغي لعسل يصبر لقريص النحل.

literal: A grand funeral for a dead mouse.
equivalent: Making a mountain out of a molehill.
darija_ar: الگنازة كبيرة والميت فار.
explanation: People making a big stink over a minor problem.

literal: One said to the other I tricked you and the other said I experienced you (for who you are).
equivalent: fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me.
darija_ar: قالو شمتك، قالو جربتك.
explanation: An awkward translation but the equivalent expression is 'fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me'.

literal: If you are raised with something you grow old with it.
equivalent: Old habits die hard.
darija_ar: اللي تربي على شي حاجة كبر عليها.

literal: One who dugs a hole fells into it.
equivalent: They dug their own grave.
darija_ar: لي حفر شي حفرة كيطيح فيها.

literal: The people are with the people and the bald guy is combing his hair.
equivalent: He's spinning his wheels.
darija_ar: الناس في الناس والقرع في مشيط الراس.
explanation: A comment on someone doing something with little or no benefit

literal: A day's wedding is a year's planning.
equivalent: Rome wasn't built in a day.
darija_ar: زواج ليلة تدبيره عام.
explanation: means that significant achievements or complex tasks require time, effort, and careful planning.

literal: The Fqih that we expect his blessing entered the Mosque while wearing his slippers.
equivalent: Don't judge a book by its cover.
darija_ar: الفقيه اللي نتسناو براكته دخل للجامع ببلغته.

literal: Tie your donkey with other donkeys, it will only learn to bray, neigh and from the path he'll stray.
equivalent: You're known by the company you keep.
darija_ar: اربط حمارك مع الحمير، يتعلم الشيق والنهيق وخرجان الطريق.
explanation: Beware of the company you keep, they will teach you bad habits.

literal: Flies do not enter a closed mouth.
equivalent: Silence is golden.
darija_ar: الفم المسدود ما يدخلو دبان.
explanation: If you don't have anything nice to say, don't say anything at all. Don't speak poorly of others.

literal: Come upstairs and have some figs, get downstairs who told you so!
equivalent: Caught between a rock and a hard place.
darija_ar: طلع تاكول الكرموس, نزل شكون قالها ليك

literal: Don't stick your hand in holes in the ground so that you don't get bitten by snakes.
equivalent: Practice common sense!
darija_ar: ماديرش يدك في غيران باش مايعضوكش الحنوشة

literal: Don't put your face in bran if you don't want to get pecked by the hens.
equivalent: Practice common sense!
darija_ar: ماديرش راسك في نخالة باش ماينقبوكش الدجاج

literal: The mice are fighting over the neighbor's yeast.
equivalent: Interfering in someone else's quarrel is like kicking a hornet's nest.
darija_ar: دابزو يا الفيران على خميرة الجيران

literal: If one says the porridge is cold, put his hand in it.
equivalent: Not seeing the forest for the trees.
darija_ar: اللي قال العصيدة باردة، ادير يدو فيها

literal: My back can only be scratched with my own fingernails.
equivalent: No one can fix my problem but myself.
darija_ar: ما يحكك اضهري غير ظفري

literal: Spend time by the babbling brook and not by the silent riverbed.
equivalent: It's always the quiet ones.
darija_ar: دوز على الواد الهرهوري ولا دوز على الواد السكوتي

literal: So many elephants have been stung by scorpions.
equivalent: Don't judge a book by its cover.
darija_ar: شحال من الفيل قرصاتوا عقرب

literal: The world is a shirt everyone wears for an hour.
equivalent: Life is short.
darija_ar: الدنيا دراعة كل واحد كيلبسها ساعة

literal: The beauty is only in the actions.
equivalent: All beauty, no brains.
darija_ar: الزين إلا زين الفعال

literal: The donkey is hiding but his ears are sticking out in plain sight.
equivalent: You can't hide from your problems.
darija_ar: الحمار مخبي ووذنيه برّا

literal: An oven that goes all around the neighborhood.
equivalent: A powerhouse.
darija_ar: فران وقاد بحومة

literal: The world gives to some people and punches others in the stomach.
equivalent: Life deals some people a good hand and others a bad one.
darija_ar: الدنيا شي عطاتو وشي زواتو

literal: The jurist Dahman read the letter for seven days and declared the handwriting was poor.
equivalent: Refusing to admit fault for one's shortcomings.
darija_ar: الفقيه دحمان، قرا البرة سبع ايام، وقاليهم الخط عيان.
